Hi Markus,

You can also have a loot at HtmlUnit, http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/ which
does support javascript. Have a loot at the differences between htmlunit and
httpunit.

Cheers,

Richard.

-----Original Message-----
From: thecyriuz82 [mailto:thecyriuz82@...] 
Sent: woensdag 18 augustus 2004 10:28
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] HttpUnit and Javascript

Hello there.

I have a problem: I want to write blackbox webtests for my Websites. 
The problem is that there often Javascript is in use. For example 
there are many checkForm()methods in use for checking if there is an 
empty mandatory field. If there is an empty field a popup (js) 
window appears with an error text.
My question: How can I test the appearance of this PopUp window and 
the contained error text as black box test?
Is it possible with httpunit or do anyone know another tool to do it?

Thanks a lot to all of you!!!

Have a nice time.

Markus
